name: Hilton New Orleans Riverside

reviews.text: We stayed 5 days at the Hilton Riverside Hotel towards the end of August. The hotel is situated at the end of Poydras Street. A trolley stop is out front. The hotel is close to the French Quarter. The problem is once you get to the lobby, you need to keep walking. Rooms are located pretty far from the lobby and, depending where it is, you need to transit multiple escalators, elevators and/or skybridges. Downsides to the hotel were that the Executive Lounge was closed to rennovations and it got very noisy on the weekend nights when people started partying in their rooms. The breakfast buffet was great - a vast selection and the hotel staff excellent. All in all, we'd probably stay at the Doubletree next time as it is closer to the French Quarter/Canal St and you dont need to hike a mile to your room.
reviews.title: HIlton Riverside Hotel - nice, but what a hike to your room

reviews.text: This Hotel is beautiful hotel, but thats it. I booked my hotel through priceline.com and stayed there on 10/9/2010. The price was a little high, but I thought it was going to be a great weekend getaway so why not pay it. Once we got there it went downhill.
reviews.title: Horrible experience for such a nice hotel

reviews.text: 1. Had to pay an additional $38 a day for parking.
reviews.title: Some problems but handled well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. If you wanted anything internet, breakfast, or anything.
reviews.title: Filthy: do not use this hotel unless you like cockroaches, dirt and rude staff

reviews.text: 3. Horrible service.
reviews.title: Great location-great customer service!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton for a social convention. It is a beautiful hotel in a great city. We arrived earlier than check in time but they let us go to our rooms.
reviews.title: Great location... excellent service

reviews.text: Fantastic location. The Street car stop is right outside the hotel, so you dont really need a car to get to the main streets (Bourbon Street, Canal, etc). The Riverwalk Mall is right across from it, but I would not buy anything until going to the French Market first. Really good prices there.
reviews.title: Quickest check in ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the Charbroiled Oysters at Drago's (restaurant at the Hotel) are just to die for! And I have not try oysters (or ever thought I would) before.
reviews.title: Very nice facility and even nicer staff

reviews.text: Clean and spacious rooms. Excellent view from the higher rooms.
reviews.title: Okay, might consider again.

reviews.text: Very efficient, check in didn't take but a few minutes and we were headed to our room. Got a room with two very comfortable queen beds. The room was very clean. The sink area was a bit small and cramped but the bathroom itself was large. Some of the areas of the motel were looking a bit 'tired' and in need of some updating and/or cleaning but nothing that would stop us from staying there again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hilton Experience

reviews.text: This was a great hotel conveniently located by the best major attractions in the Quarters. Harrah's is directly across from it. The hotel staff were very friendly and always willing to assist in whatever I needed. I always had clean towels and a clean room. The water pressure in the shower was perfect, the room size was just right. The pillows were soooo comfortable! I almost stole one! The beds were pretty comfy too. The hotel provides complimentary Lavazza coffee in the rooms. It's very smooth, I like it better than Starbucks coffee! I got a room with a wonderful view of the Mississippi at a great rate. I didn't have any problems with noise coming from other rooms and I am a very light sleeper. Self parking is $34, Valet is $40. I decided to park at the Shops on Canal for $25 for every 24 hrs. It was very close so if you are looking to save some money that may be something you may want to try. There is a fee for internet use and the fitness center if you require that stuff, it sucks but if you want to stay in shape get your butt outside and jog. It's free!!! There are also places in the quarters that have fee wifi if you really really need it. Or you can just shut up and pay the fee.
reviews.title: I'm glad I ignored the negative reviews!

reviews.text: I am very pleased with this hotel, its one of the few I can say that about. Not one thing negative to say about my stay.
reviews.title: The Hilton gets better every time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed during Labor Day and were thoroughly impressed by this Hilton property. The location, property, and staff are superb. Dawn Droughn, hotel management, does a great job and the Hilton is lucky to have her. We were most impressed by the in-room amenities and the central location of the hotel. Overall A+ stay. This is what we have come to expect with Hilton properties and Dawn Droughn is a big reason why.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: We spent New Year's here, and I couldn't have asked for a better trip!! This hotel has it all; great seafood restaurant right in the beautiful lobby, very close to the streetcar stop for transit, and within walking distance of the French Quarter and all of the sights. Room was very spacious and beautifully decorated. Staff were friendly. Service in the hotel bar was slow, and the bartender didn't know how to make some of my boyfriend's drinks, but other than that minor inconvenience, it was an awesome trip!
reviews.title: Great location, would stay here again!!

reviews.text: The hotels location is great. Right by the riverwalk and opposite Harrahs casino and hotel. To walk to the French Quarter was only about two large blocks until you were on Canal street and then the French Quarter was at your feet!
reviews.title: One hotel/two trips/two different experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was almost the perfect stay until got my qx56 back from the valet. We parked the truck the whole weekend and walked or took a cab to locations we visited. When I got my truck back Sunday there was a scratch on the passenger side going from the front door all the way pass the back tire area. It would not be so bad if they would just pay for the damage without giving me problems, but as of now they are refusing to pay! I asked Mr. Kevyn Lewis (the security supervisor) if there was cameras so we can see WHO damaged my truck, but he told me there wasn't any cameras. Now the claims lady (Sherry Carpools) says the reason they are not paying the claim is because camera show my car being taken and returned without. (NOW ALL OF THE SUDDEN THERE ARE CAMERAS??) I told Sherry that I wanted to see the tapes and read the report, she told me that information could not be released. WHY????
reviews.title: DO NOT ALLOW THEM TO VALET YOU CAR AT THE RIVERSIDE LOCATION IN NEW ORLEANS!!
Not so good
reviews.text: I stayed 6 nights last week and will not stay there again- HILTON you fail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paper thin walls, could hear the neighbor flush and shower!!!! Could not understand why the door let in so much noise??? I live in NYC and I hardly hear noise in my hallway.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loud obnoxious over 50's somethings, gambling types who stay there because it is across from a major casino. I felt like, "Wow, who let the" not" trained adults out of their cage?"
reviews.title: Great hotel and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 am to 5 am every night people carousing up and down the halls screaming like a bunch of 5-year-old's on a soccer field.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Great Location!

reviews.text: Really works for such a very large hotel next to (or really near to) convention center. Good public spaces; staff well organized. Decent restaurants - especially grilled oysters in Drago's. Lots of nearby shopping and of course lots of good restaurants within walking distance in the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Great convention hotel

reviews.text: We spent a few night at the Hilton New Orleans Riverside. The location is great for the convention center and easy walking distance to the tourist sights. New Orleans is a pretty easy city to walk and see the sights. The room was very nice and the bed was comfortable. It was kept clean and tidy daily. We were in an executive room which allowed us to go to the executive club. Breakfast was served daily and there were snacks served during the day. There is coffee, tea ,sodas and water available all day. I think the club should be about three times larger, as it was really crowded at breakfast and hard to find a place to sit. The cash bar was pretty pricey. We have stayed in Hiltons on the executive levels in Europe and they never charge for alcoholic drinks. Maybe something the US Hiltons should think about. The view in the club was amazing. We enjoyed our stay at this Hilton.
reviews.title: Nice Stay on the Executive Level

reviews.text: I requested a room away from the elevator that wish was granted! The rooms were spacious and the beds were quite comfy! I have not heard a peep for the 4 nights I was here.. The floor plan, is simple and easy to get around, and the staff well I didnt have much interaction as I rarely needed anything. My room was kept nice and clean, it felt fresh! I had a queen room with a view of the river. This hotel is accessible to the street cars, walking distances of many attractions and it felt safe.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: The location is ideal: it's on the river, it's a short walking distance to the convention center, it's across the street from Harrah's if you like to gamble and it's at the edge of the French Quarter. The room we stayed in was clean and seemed updated. We were on one of the executive floors and really enjoyed the convenience of having the option to eat a continental breakfast in the executive lounge. They also offer afternoon snacks.
reviews.title: Perfect location, especially of you are attending a convention.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend the restaurant Drago's. Fast service, even though it seemed super busy. The broiled oysters were delicious.
reviews.title: Great Stay in a Great City

reviews.text: What a poor excuse for an upscale hotel. I stayed here for five nights in April attending a conferenceand occupied two different rooms. Here's my experience:
reviews.title: Avoid if Possible

likes.liked: — being on the river because of the music festival with live bands

reviews.text: --long check-in lines
reviews.title: would stay here again

reviews.text: --no offer of help with luggage
reviews.title: Slow elevators - No New Orleans charm

likes.liked: — Hilton Honors Lounge - fantastic views of the river

reviews.text: --unhelpful front desk staff
reviews.title: Pleasant But Understaffed
great location, comfort you expect from hilton, cheap on priceline offseason!
reviews.text: --small cramped rooms

Although at check to get my room at the main desk I was informed my room wasn't ready. Then after getting my room on the Executive floor and just starting to unwind a couple tried to enter the room. They were given the same room as me an hour later than my check in. Executive concierge corrected the error quickly. A rough start but the rest of the stay was great. Very large clean room, nice staff that was very helpful in giving me directions. The view of the Mississippi is awesome. I will recommend to friends every time I hear they are traveling to New Orleans. I will be back. Hotel borders the river walk and is easily within walking distance of the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great river view

reviews.text: Our room was very clean. We were on the executive level which includes breakfast and snacks on the concierge level with great views of the Mississippi. The meat pies are great in the late afternoon. Luckily the breakfast selection is healthy since the rest of what we ate surely wasn't.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant Drago's is not to be missed either. I am not an oyster lover but those charbroiled oysters are to die for!
reviews.title: LOVE THIS PLACE

reviews.text: I stay here every year for the Bayou Classic held on Thanksgiving weekend. This hotel has it all. Great location. Nice rooms. Friendly and efficient staff. Classy. I am partial to the Hilton chains and for the value, it gets no better than The Hilton Riverside. Convenient access to the Riverwalk also.
reviews.title: Big Easy pre-cruise hotel stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me begin by saying how FANTASTIC the STAFF at this Hilton are!! They were phenomenal!! From the sales department that blocked the group space to the young lady at check in these people were very professional and accommodating.
reviews.title: My favorite New Orleans Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room through a bidding website as it was a somewhat last minute Mardi Gras reservation (my 7th trip back to the city since Katrina). While I knew I would not be given any 'Hhonors' points for my stay, I did not expect to be treated like a leper. I phoned the hotel to A) have my Gold Hhonors number added to the reservation, and B) merely request a non-smoking room. I was informed that NO information can be added to my reservation; they claim the computer 'won't allow' it. They also advised me I was booked in a smoking room. Okay...that was a risk I took.
reviews.title: Incredibly short-sited.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I then inquired as to my Gold Hhonors perks, other than points (which, again, I knew I would not receive when booking outside of the Hilton site). Specifically, I wished to use the fitness room. I was informed--Nope! Can't use the fitness center, nada, nothing. UNBELIEVABLE. What harm does it bring them to allow me on a treadmill that is mostly sitting there anyway?? Oh, MY! I even phoned Hilton Hhonors; they insisted it's 'in the disclaimer' that you must book through Hilton to receive any perks. I then asked them to provide that information to me. Of course, they couldn't...even after sitting on hold for 10 minutes. Cuz it ain't there!!! Then it became 'It's up to each hotel's discretion'.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Pre Cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrifically stupid on Hilton's part; they've just lost a long-time, loyal guest over the use of a treadmill and a bottle of water. See y'all at the 'big M' joints in the future. They're ALL non-smoking, 100%.
reviews.title: Favorite place to stay in New Orleans
Pleased with Room
reviews.text: Great Hotel, very clean and modern. The location is excellent if you are leaving on a cruise. There are currently doing some remodeling but that didn't take anything away from the hotel. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We visit New Orleans quite regularly and the towers here are our favorite place to stay. I can not speak for the regular rooms, but only the tower levels. The appetizers and breakfast alone are well worth the extra price. You get speedy 29th floor check-in and a private concierage level with a beautiful view of downtown New Orleans on one side and the Mississippi river on the other. I love that it's connected to the Riverwalk and they have a great brunch on Sundays at the sports bar on the main level. The trolley stops right out front for a cheap ride to the quarter.
reviews.title: Handy for Ernst N Morial Centre

reviews.text: We stayed here on an extended weekend and it was fine - nothing spectacular. Staff was friendly. Room size was average with a view of the river. The maid did not refill the tissue box or leave an extra roll of toilet paper, otherwise everything else in the room looked clean. Room service is not 24 hours, which is a negative for me. There are two pools at this hotel - both pretty basic, but much needed for the New Orleans summer. One side of the hotel looked like it had been updated and remodeled recently. We were on the other side, but it seems like work will probably start soon. As we were checking out, there were contractors going in. Drago's Restaurant was great for drinks and oysters. The mall at Riverwalk connected to the hotel was pretty lacking - other than Cafe Du Monde, we thought it was a total waste of space. The shops were awful.
reviews.title: decent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about a quick 15 minute walk to Bourbon Street and restaurants/shops. On walking down Bourbon Street, I was glad we did not choose a hotel on the street - noisy and odor was not pleasant.
reviews.title: Great service but entirely too noisy

reviews.text: Harrah's casino is right across the street, so you can walk through to get on the main road - perfect on a hot summer's day.
reviews.title: Crazy Parking Rates

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was just okay, nothing spectacular.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - great location

reviews.text: The larger Hiltons have a tendency to be too noisy and this is no exception. We got a great rate on the room and were upgraded to a larger room with a River view based on my Hilton status; we asked to change rooms after one night dealing with the excessive hallway noise, which included a screaming baby 2 doors down. The baby would scream for an hour or two at a stretch and while it's the parents' fault and not the hotel for not calming the baby down, it really ruined our stay (which was supposed to be an impromptu romantic getaway).
reviews.title: scratched car
INDIFFERENT/ DISORGANIZED AT FRONT DESK
reviews.text: stayed here for convention. Good location that was a plus.. but the staff at the reception desk not very professional nor the assist mang or mang Ispoke with. just did not seem to care. The first negative is I was given a room key and went to the room and open the door and a woman and man were in the bed . luckily they were watching tv. So that was embarassing. So I called the front desk and told them of my prob and theydid not send anyone upstairs to help me theywanted me to pull my luggage BACK downstairs to get a new room so not very accomodating or customer service focused. The accomodations were ok.. there was some noise so Imoved again. So I technically had THREE rooms in 3 days! at the same hotel. I left and just went to the Holiday Inn last night. It was less expensive and people seemed to care that I was a customer. The Hilton was very indifferent I felt.

reviews.title: Decent place for decent value
reviews.text: I'd booked the Hilton through Priceline and got a room for $45 or $50, which I thought was a good deal for a Hilton, until I got hit with parking fees per day!!

reviews.title: Excellent!!!
reviews.text: We were assigned some random room through priceline, but they gave us a riverside room when asked. I'm sure there are other better rooms than what we got. Ours was a very basic one, like any other decent hotel room, it was not mouldy or smelly like others seem to have experienced, nor was it "Hilton" style.

reviews.title: St. Francis Would Be Proud!
reviews.text: The hotel is just too big for individual attention. Plus we were there at Christmas time with hoardes of other travellers. Since we were on a sightseeing trip spending very little time in the hotel room and the rest of the time in the French Quarter, we didn't mind at all. I did get a little annoyed at the conceirge desk when we waited for about half an hour for the person to get off the phone only to be told to look at some brochures and were dismissed.

reviews.title: Clean but Noisy!
reviews.text: The location is good, just a couple of minutes walk from the french quarter, though even that can get a little tiring if you are not used to walking (or walk with high heels). We would hang out in the french quarter and walk back, stopping at Harrah's casino in front of the Hilton for some live music and fun.

The rooms were nice, as well as clean, and the location was near the river and a short trolley ride from the French Quarter. The staff was very helpful and we definitely enjoyed our stay. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
reviews.title: Great location, clean rooms, and friendly staff.

reviews.text: We had three families with 4 rooms reserved two month before our intended arrival date during the week of Christmas. We had confirmed reservation for 4 rooms before our Caribbean cruise. Upon arrival, we were told that they had no rooms for us (given no reason other than they were full). We were only offered taxi fares (which it wasn't even enough for our limo driver who was waiting outside for about an hour trying to sort things out). Finally, we were told to go to Embassy Suites and when we got there, we were told that they also don't have rooms and wanted to send ut to another Hilton property. I have been staying at Hilton for over 25 years, and this is the worst I have ever been treated. Finally, we were given a staff's room, which had no window a very small bed for myself and my son who is about my size. One of the family had a room that had no A/C, even though we were informed the defective A/C, but we took it anyway since we don't want to move to another property. Another family of 2 adults and 2 young children had to share one bed. The nice staff at the Embassy Suites did offer us free dinner (actually the offer only cover half of out bill), but still, it was a nice gesture. Eventually, Hilton Riverside contacted me and offered two nights at Hilton Riverside for a future stay. That of course is meaningless, I have only been in New Orleans twice in the last 30 years, and had no plan to return to New Orleans in the next few years. What a horrible experience. I don't recommend anyone staying at this terrible place. How can a reputable hotel cancel a confirmed reservation that was made two months before the arrival date and nearly ruined a Christmas vacation for 3 families.
reviews.title: Terrible customer service

reviews.text: Just completed my 10th trip to New Orleans and this is my first time staying at this hotel. While the hotel is adjacent to the French Quarter and the Business District, its biggest draw is that it in fact Riverfront. Note, that not all rooms are river front or river view. Members of our party had nondescript views of parking decks, skyline views, etc. ( I did luck up and get a river front room). The room had two double beds and was not exactly spacious.
reviews.title: Nice, but nothing exceptionally special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor of the hallways is in need of major updating. The carpets are worn and starting to fade. The wall paper is decades old and detracts from the quality of the hotel.
reviews.title: Marginal Functional !
One of my favorite "Big" Hotels
reviews.text: Staff are friendly and check in was quick and efficient. The mattress was a bit firm for my liking, but it was not a complete rock.

Recently down in New Orleans for a bachelor party. Our whole group stayed at Hilton Riverside. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating and helpful in setting up our stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable with views of the Mississippi! There is also a very nice hotel bar and Drago's on the first floor has amazing oysters!
reviews.title: Great Hotel with Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel also is in a great location. Right across the street from Harrah's and Riverfront and a short walk to all the French Quarter attractions.
reviews.title: The customer Service at this hotel is excellent

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend hotel for its quality and location!
reviews.title: HAD A GREAT TRIP

reviews.text: Great hotel close to harrahs a few steps from the French Quarter also shopping restaurants and attractions
reviews.title: Great location, Great time!

reviews.text: Make sure you ask for a river view. I stayed about a month ago and the view was of a parking garage & I was very disappointed. This stay was great. The view of the river was excellent and it was nice to see the sun rise in the morning over the river. It is across the street from Harrah's casino, which was great & not a far walk at all. The aquarium & the Imax theatre are in walking distance, too. The Riverwalk is right there also with plenty of shopping and specialty stores. Over all this was a very nice trip. THE BEDDING AND PILLOW ARE EXCELLENT AND THE ROOM WAS VERY CLEAN.
reviews.title: MARDI GRAS 2011

reviews.text: This hotel is located at a great location. It is on the edge of the French Quarter, adjacent to the convention center, and close to the Central Business District and has all the emntities you would expect from a Hilton Hotel.
reviews.title: Full service, quiet hotel at a convenient location

reviews.text: My family have been traveling to New Orleans for three generations, and we always stay at the Riverside Hilton. We've only stayed at another hotel twice. This hotel is a fantastic idea for several reasons: (1) the views of the river are wonderful, (2) it's quiet, (3) it's a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter, (4) it is attached to the River Market, which is very convenient when the weather is rough, and (5) the rooms are excellent. The fact that it's attached to the River Market is great for a lot of reasons. The River Market is indoors, which provides good entertainment when the weather is bad, and the food court is excellent - including Mike Anderson's seafood (i.e. this is not the food court you have at your suburban malls at home). So, we can enjoy a good meal in doors, without a long line, and with great views of the river when it's convenient. Otherwise, we're out in the French Quarter all day and night. The walk is about 10 minutes, and there is a lovely riverside park to use to get there that makes for a very pleasant walk. Or, if it's windy, we use Canal St. and are shielded by the buildings. We like that at the end of a long day or night, the Riverside Hilton is a quiet peaceful retreat away from the French Quarter crowds and noise. Also, it's always host to one of the teams/fans for the Sugar Bowl, which is a good indication. If a 10 minute walk is too long for you, the cab rides are cheap. The kids love to sit by the windows in the room to watch the huge ships/barges navigate the river (and the adults do too). This hotel should be ranked higher on Trip Advisor than it is because of the views and location. I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in New Orleans.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay!!!!

reviews.text: With the rush of a "live" production, one tends to give up "comforts" and often courtesy. The Staff and Management of The Hilton New Orleans Riverside, from Lisa Rosevally in the executive office down to Linda and Vanessa in Roomservice, were exceptional in every way imaginable. Every need from extra towels to extra ketchup were readily provided along with friendly smiles and genuine concern for our comforts. The HIlton New Orleans Riverside is a "must destination" for anyone traveling to New Orleans.
reviews.title: Lisa and her staff were exceptional in every aspect of quality and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for making our time in New Orleans so delightful.
reviews.title: Fantistic & Delightful with lots of spice & a perfect location.

reviews.text: We have been staying at this hotel for the past 3 years. It has such a pleasant and friendly atmosphere. Everyone bends over backwards to accompany you. Easy to check in and out. Because of the location we're in walking distance of everything you can think of; shopping, gambling, French Quarters, Cathedral, Horse and carriage ride, WWII museum, not to mention the great restaurant inside the hotel, and surrounding the hotel. We consider the Hilton a superb place to fell at home away from home.
reviews.title: From Check in to Check out = PERFECT

reviews.text: My wife and I checked into the Hilton Riverside on September 18 and stayed for five nights. I booked the hotel with one of the hotel's summer sales and got an excellent price. Because, I am a gold Hilton Honors member, even with the sale price, the hotel gave us free internet access and an upgrade to the executive tower with access to the executive lounge with free breakfast and evening snacks. Our room on the 25th floor had wonderful views of both the river and the french quarter. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet. Black out curtains let us sleep as long as we wanted. All staff were very friendly. Even though we arrived two hours before the posted check in time, a room was immediately available. I travel frequently and this was one of the best hotel stays I have experienced.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at the Hilton Riverside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several tips. A taxi ride from the airport to the Hilton is $33 for one or two people. With the two of us, it was actually less expensive than the shuttle. There are many excellent restaurants in NOLA. I found discounted gift certificates for sale on Restaurants.com. I bought $10 gift certificates for eighty cents and $25 gift certificates for $2. At this price, I bought gift certificates for 10 different restaurants and paid less than $20 for all of them. This gave us plenty of choice depending on our mood at the time. You can only use one certificate at a time and you must purchase a minimum amount to qualify; however, my wife and I were able to keep our dining expenses down using them.
reviews.title: nice, clean place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the New Orleans cooking school one day for lunch and it turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip. We learned about the different cultural influences on New Orleans cooking and learned how to make gumbo, jambalaya, bread pudding and pecan pralines which then became our lunch. Beverages served with lunch included coffee, tea, and locally bottled root beer and beer. The lunch was filling and what a bargain for $27.
reviews.title: Property Gone Downhill

reviews.text: Another highlight of our trip was lunch at the Commander's Palace. The three course special with three cups of different soup, grilled red fish with lobster, and bread pudding souffle was exceptional. Also, during lunch, they serve $0.25 martinis (I had three).
reviews.title: Parking was just as much as the hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Usually my wife only wants to visit a city one time, but she really wants to visit New Orleans again. I'm sure we'll stay at the Hilton Riverside on our next trip.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Not too fancy

reviews.text: The Hilton Riverside is one of a number of Hilton properties in the New Orleans area. Be sure to be specific, or your cab driver may drop you off at the wrong place. The hotel is a typical large convention hotel. It is adjacent to the New Orleans Convention Center on the banks of the Mississippi River. The area is a crowded mix of hotels, offices, restaurants and casinos.
reviews.title: Big convention hotel near the French Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk is located on the second floor and the front desk staff were efficient and pleasant enough. Check in process was quick and I was lucky to be upgraded to a room on one of the executive floors. I do not know if this makes the room any nicer, but it does give access to the executive lounge which has snacks, etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location - Awesome stay

reviews.text: Elevators were small and a little dimly lit inside making seeing the elevator buttons take a moment. The waits for elevators were not unreasonably long, and they travelled smoothly and rapidly to the floor. The hallways are well lit and clean. If you ask for a quiet room you will have a bit of a walk from the elevator, but it is worth it if hallway noise bothers you.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The room was clean and decorated in typical business hotel style. The room was large enough to house a king bed, dresser, desk and armchair. One nice window offered good light and a nice view of the river. The lighting in the room was sufficient and the closet space adequate with a nice sized safe in the closet. Lamps all had two outlets built into them allowing sufficient space for plugging in cell phones, tablets, laptops, etc. Television was a nice size with a good picture. Decor seemed new, but was un-inspired.
reviews.title: A Premier Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was on the small side. The kind of bathroom where you have to walk in and step to the side to close the door. The fixtures were clean and solid, the tile appeared clean and the grout looked okay - like it was passable but could have used a cleaning. The sink was clogged and slowly filled up while I was brushing my teeth. Luckily i caught it before it overflowed.
reviews.title: Get the river view
Nice hotel, watch out for the thin walls
reviews.text: Spent the weekend here, staff was pleasant, the location is good (across the street from the casino) but the walls were very thin. Avoid the rooms adjacent to the elevators shaft... unless you enjoy the bass rumble of a semi truck reverberating through your pillow all night.

reviews.title: great location, overall good experience
reviews.text: I recently stayed here for a conference. This was my first trip to NO. I was very satisfied with my experience at the hotel. I found the rooms to be perfectly clean, sizeable, and I was lucky to get a tower room with a view of the river. (I did hear some grumblings from colleagues in the other part of the hotel, so I'd probably ask for a tower room.) Room service was efficient. I found the concierge to be helpful (although the desk closed at 7:30pm), and I had no trouble getting to and from my room in the elevators -- and this was during Jazz Fest!

reviews.title: Great Jazzfest !
reviews.text: Also, the location is great. You can walk along the river, or walk to the French Quarter or the Warehouse District. Harrah's casino is right across the street and many great restaurants are within walking distance.

reviews.title: Terrific JazzFest stay!
reviews.text: On the down side: I also found the hotel to be somewhat understaffed. There was a short wait at the front desk when I went down there. Once there was no one there and a few of us standing around. This may be attributable to Katrina and the difficulty of recruiting workers. It was a minor annoyance and was far outweighed by the other positive aspects of the hotel.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton 5/4 to 5/7 for the 2nd weekend of Jazzfest and it was GREAT. The hotel is walking distance to the French Quarter, and it was about $3 per person for a taxi. Booked thru Priceline and got a good deal. Will definitely stay here again!

reviews.title: The Total Package!!
reviews.text: We spent 1 night at the Riverside Hilton and it was great. We had a early check-in and everyone was so nice. The room was beautiful with a great view. All of the accomodations were 1st class down to the plush bath robes and the great king size bed.
Would surley stay here again. DmLowrey,Shreveport
reviews.title: This hotel charges you money to pick up your own mail!

reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Location Is Everything!

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice...fairly luxurious clean rooms, good staff, etc. My coworkers and I had some light mail sent to us at the hotel from the offices. It was mainly a few things that we had forgotten prior to the conference. When the hotel told us that we had mail waiting for us, we went to pick it up and they charged us $50USD for the right to pick up our own mail (two packages). Can you say "RIP OFF?" I have stayed in many hotels and I have never been charged to pick up my own mail. Shouldn't being able to receive one's mail be a basic service for guests who are paying hundreds of dollars a night to stay in a hotel? On principle alone, I suggest avoiding this place. If you like nice rooms though, and don't have any mail coming, it is fine.
reviews.title: WHAT FUN AT REST (FAR).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Riverside is in the heart of New Orleans. It is in walking distance to all the major touristy attractions, to delicious local restaurants, and to incredible boutique shopping. The view of the river is not too bad either!
reviews.title: Hilton New Orleans is the place to be

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton New Orleans Riverside for 3 nights in February while attending a conference at the nearby Morial Convention Center.
reviews.title: Pleasant business stay

reviews.text: Generally speaking I was very pleased with the hotel.
reviews.title: Almost as Good as it Gets
Great Experience
reviews.text: The hotel has a very large, well-decorated lobby. This is clearly a convention hotel - there is seating everywhere, and open bars on both the first and second lobby levels. During trade conventions these areas can become very crowded and noisy during the day and early evening.

reviews.title: Pleasant stay
reviews.text: I stay frequently at Hiltons, and upon check-in I was upgraded to an executive-level room on the 24th floor. I was on the World Trade center side of the building, which afforded a fantastic view of a large bend in the Mississippi. I greatly enjoyed spending the little down time I had watching the ships and barges navigating that part of the river. Room appointments were well above average, the room was clean, and the bed very comfortable. It might be a bit on the soft side for some but personally I enjoyed it. Rooms have access to wireless internet for $9.95 per day billed to the room or credit card.

reviews.title: Very Deliteful
reviews.text: The executive rooms have access to a hospitality suite on the 29th floor. This is a great place to grab a quick breakfast in the morning, hordouvers in the afternoon, and coffee or non-alcoholic drinks throughout the day. You can relax in front of a panoramic view of Ol' Man River below.

For a Hilton, this was disappointing. Check in took 25 mins but I must admit that there were a lot of people staying because of a conference. Service was slow and the man at the concierge was rude and unhelpful. On two occassions, I was left on hold on the telephone for a long while and in the end I had to hang up before a reply. The rooms were slightly depressing in their colour and feel. But I must point out that it was comfortable and clean. Some of the staff did go out of their way to help. There was a wireless internet service but no wired access. The French quarter was a ten minute walk away and the hotel overlooks the Mississippi. Overall, very poor for the price and service needs to be improved.
reviews.title: Poor for a Hilton

reviews.text: I stayed in Oct 06 as part of a large conference, one of the first conferences to return to New Orleans. The hotel was largely fine, one wouldn't have known on the surface about the recent calamity. The major issue with the hotel: the 'non-smoking' rooms distinctly smelled of smoke. I guess they couldn't maintain their no-smoking policy in every room over the last year, and I have a sensitive nose. My first room smelled of smoke - I asked for a transfer (gracefully granted) but the second one was just as bad. Not hideous (probably a while ago that someone smoked in it) but noticable to me. However other guests didn't comment on this. The hotel was generally well maintained, seemed adequately staffed, service was very friendly and usually fine, public areas were pleasant. There was some fraying around the edges: carpets in the hallways seemed slightly worn, service was sometimes careless (leaving a door open to the kitchen at a conference) - but nothing substantive. As a large hotel, it's not as full of character as some others, but the location is good (easy walk to both convention center and French Quarter and on the Riverwalk mall).
reviews.title: Recovering but stayable

likes.disliked: — Non smoking rooms smelled of smoke

reviews.text: New Orleans in general is definitely visitable and recovering, from a tourist's point of view. Our large conference went off without a hitch. Some shops aren't open yet, some restaurants have limited hours: but in general the city feels vibrant, not ghostly and tragic - and the residents are very glad to have tourists and conferences back. Go and tip well.
reviews.title: Oh Dear
Can't handle complicated reservations
reviews.text: We'd stayed in the Hilton Riverside before and it had been the usual Hilton experience, comfortable room, expensive internet, functional but not spectacular.

reviews.title: A Hilton Really???
reviews.text: We stayed here in October for a couple of nights before moving to the Monteleone and were very disappointed by the room and the service.

It's a city hotel- BIG and a little confusing. The section we stayed in was a HIKE from the garage. Whole sections on the side we were staying were closed- I am guessing from lack of business. It was depressing to have to get thru this large area to our section of the hotel. They had remodeled one bldng and u could see the workers doing another section. It did not disturb us in terms of noise just the visual. Maybe it will all improve but for $186.16 (parking & taxes) right now, it was just OK.
reviews.title: OK, not great, just OK

reviews.text: I just returned from an International Red Hat Society Convention in New Orleans. This is an all ladies society and we wear our red hats and have nothing but fun, fun, and more fun.
reviews.title: I will stay at this hotel when I return for another fun time

reviews.text: Our room overlooked the Mississippi River. Check in was quick, service was superb in the restaurant and the bar. To die for was the charbroilled oysters at Drago's Restaurant in the hotel. Absolutely the best I have tasted anywhere.
reviews.title: A New Orleans Gem

reviews.text: The conceirge was very helpful as I had never been to New Orleans before and needed ideas of what was the most important to see as I was only there for 5 days.
reviews.title: Good place.

reviews.text: Everything a person could need was available right outside the hotel door. eg, trolleys, buses, taxi, shopping, casino. Just the best time I have had in a long time.
reviews.title: 2 star quality, 4 star prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in to Executive Level at this hotel. We had a very brief wait for our room and waited in the Executive Lounge on the top floor (29th floor). Execeptional customer service and awesome views from the high level floors. We preferred the city view to the river view and it was so awesome at night. It is in a great location, we could walk everywhere we wanted to go, the Riverwalk Mall was connected to the hotel by enclosed walkway, few blocks from French Quarter...we like to walk. It was directly across the street from Harrah's Casino too. Although we had some very rowdy neighbors who were fighting and actually totally trashed their room, security handled the matter swiftly and quietly.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here New Year's Eve and New Year's Day while attending the Sugar Bowl and related festivities. We arrived two hours before check in, but did not have to wait for our room. The check in was very quick, which is amazing considering how busy the hotel was. Our room was very nice and extremely clean. The bed was awesome; we hated to come home to our own! The shower had good water pressure and was nice and hot. The hotel puts out Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries and these were replenished daily and generously (two shampoos and new soaps even though we still had most of the soap left). Nice big and fluffy towels! The hotel was extremely busy with Sugar bowl fans, but every staff member was friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is so convenient to everything. We walked to the French Quarter and also to the Superdome. I never felt unsafe. Overall it was a wonderful stay and I will always stay here when in New Orleans. Go Gators!!
reviews.title: I loved staying here!

reviews.text: Spent a few days here with family over Christmas. Had the hotel to ourselves. Everything was great. Only downside was the Exceutive Loung was closed for the holidays, which was made up for with generous breakfast vouchers. Hotel traffic picjked up considerably fater Christmas for the Saints game and upcoming Sugar Bowl. In all, a great experience.
reviews.title: Great for Christmas

reviews.text: This hotel is on the Riverwalk linked to the mall and within walking distance to many popular attractions- This hotel is our favorite in New Orleans.
reviews.title: Safe and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time we've stayed at this hotel and again it was more than we expected. The staff is extrememly helpful and personable beginning with the valet and continuing to the frontdesk. We had cocktails at Dragos - a martini, a cosmo and charbroiled oysters, delicious! - and the bartender made us feel like we were at our neighborhood bar. We had a riverview room, very comfortable, very clean and even better, very quiet. Although Hilton Riverside is a big hotel, it seems to strive toward making you feel like you are their special guest. Great location too. They also offer very competitive rates and packages. We will definitely stay there on our next trip to N.O.
reviews.title: Another Perfect Stay

reviews.text: Great hotel!! Very nice, clean and nice folks in general. Drago's restaurant is fantastice. Room service is lightening fast and personable!!!
reviews.title: Doesn't get better than this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed Saturday through Tuesday in mid-November for $99 a night. Great location, walking distance to the French Quarter, Canal St and Bourbon St. Didn't eat at the restaurant in the hotel, but the menu looked alright. The riverwalk stores open late and close early which was disappointing. Hotel is right across from the casino, all in all we were pleased.
reviews.title: Great price for the location

reviews.text: Room was big, with nice king bed, nice hot shower, maid service was good, nothing fancy. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton hosted a function for us and the staff is by far the best I have ever worked with. We stayed at the hotel for two nights and it was a great experience. Everything is done first class. There can't be ahotel that doe things any better.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay and so convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms at this Hilton are spacious and beautiful. We stayed in the Towers and had a terrific view of the river. The Drago's Restaurant on site has THE BEST Chargrilled oysters. The lobby and public areas are nicely appointed. Staff is very responsive! Only downside is that there is a charge for the Internet, rather unheard of these days. Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Stand up and applaud the Hilton New Orleans Riverside!
Worthwhile Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at this Hotel prior to our cruise on the Carnival Conquest on December 11, 2004. We were able to get the pre-cruise special which included 7 nights of parking, although we did not utilize the parking. I opted for a Suite, so we paid $149 for the room, which for New Orleans, is a pretty good deal.

reviews.title: Great Views
reviews.text: Check in was efficient and professional. We arrived to the hotel at 11am and our assigned room was available for us to check in. We had a river view room looking directly at the river and could also see the Cruise Ships when they arrived the next morning. The room was of reasonable size and was in an outstanding state of repair. The beds were very comfortable. It is my understanding that these rooms were recently renovated.

reviews.title: Horrible-avoid at all costs. There are better hotels
reviews.text: We did go down to the pools during the evening and I found them to be old and not in the best of condition. The hot tub was lukewarm at best, and the jets did not work. This is not something that I would expect of a Hilton Hotel.

reviews.title: Locals love the Hilton
reviews.text: Overall we were impressed with our room and would stay here again without question. I don't usually choose my hotels based upon swimming pools and hot tubs. If this is your thing, you need to stay elsewhere.

reviews.title: We always end up returnign here after trying other hotels
reviews.text: I liked the fact that I was out of the teaming masses in the quarter, but could still be there in five minutes by cab. Loved the views of the river. The pool was all right. I'd classify this as a big convention style hotel.

reviews.title: Stayed here many times..keep coming back!
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Hilton Riverside many times. They have always honored any requests that I have made. Their new bedding is wonderful. The location is great...close to French Quarter, all river attractions,Mothers Resturant (my favorite)!!!, and of course the Riverwalk is right there! The rooms are a bit noisy at night. Seems to me that people would try to gently close their doors at night! I know that I try to!

reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.text: Got a dirt cheap package deal including air and hotel from Priceline so wasn't expecting much for the money however we were pleasantly suprised. I called ahead and asked for a room as high up in the tower as possible with a view of the river. The person I spoke with was courteous and pleasant and more improtantly honored my request! We arrived in early afternoon and were checked into a room on the 20th floor in less than 10 minutes. Not only did we have a great view of the river but a fantastic view of the city a well....SPECTACULAR AT NIGHT!!! The room was spotless and nicely appointed with upscale furnishings in shades of rich mahagonies and greens which gave a very plush feel. The bathroom was spotless as well and very well appointed with a marble vanity and complimentary soaps and lotions. Towels were in plentiful supply. The trolley stopped right outside the hotel entrance and wisked us down to the center of N.O. in no time flat. The hotel is connected to a mall which is convenient however we found the stores expensive and nothing out of the ordinary, most of which can be found in just about any mall in the U.S.. One plus is that there is branch of Cafe du Monde in the mall so if have an early morning craving for beignets you don't have to travel all the way down to the other end of the city get a bagfull...its a lot less crowded too. If you like to gamble Caesers is right across the street and even if you don't take a quick walk through anyway. We stayed 5 nights at the Hilton and all in all it was an extremely enjoyable experience and I would definately stay here again.

We stayed at the Hilton from August 21 -25, 2004. The Hilton was beautiful. This hotel is located in front of Harrah's casino. There are many hotels in the vicinity. The hotel overlooks the Mississippi River and the famous Riverwalk (shopping mall). It is walking distance to the French Quarter and the aquarium.
reviews.title: Great Location
Didn't want to leave!
reviews.text: The room was big and luxurious. The air conditioning was perfect. The room service and the restaurants were outstanding. There is a little cafe in the lobby where you can get a bagel and coffee for about $3.00.

reviews.title: Nice view of the city
reviews.text: We stayed there after our cruise and it was wonderful. The cabbie will charge you $7 per person to take you from the pier to the hotel (either direction). From the hotel it will cost you $27 for two people to the New Orleans Airport which is about 30 minutes (in good traffic).

aka: Hilton New Orleans Riverside Hotel New Orleans
description: Visiting the Hilton New Orleans Hotel Riverside will not only bring back fond memories, but can open up new areas to explore in New Orleans, Louisiana. Enjoy the 90,000 sq. ft. Health Club by Hilton featuring tennis, racquetball, full weight training circuit, the Precor® cardio theater and more. Stimulate your palate within Drago's Seafood Restaurant, a New Orleans dining institution. Upgrade your accommodations to our exclusive Executive Level. Try your hand at Harrah's Casino or take in a round of golf at TPC Louisiana. New Orleans is still one of the world's most unique destinations and is at your doorstep when staying at the Hilton Riverside Hotel in New Orleans, Louisiana.
